page.title: 05THE CHANGING VILLAGE
page.content: We have been interviewing people who have been living in the village on average 53 years. 60% of the people we interviewed went to the school in the village. One of the changes of the school in the village, is there used to be 210 children, 7 teachers and 7 classes, now there are 89 children, 6 teachers (3 part time) and 4 classes. We wear red and white school uniform, they wore white dainty frocks. The main changes in the village are houses, shopping and roads. 75% of the people we interviewed liked the changes. Everybody agreed the changes are for the better. However nobody liked the idea of making Binfield bigger. 99% thought we should have a new school. Everybody thought there should be more places for senior citizens. What people like best about the village is the country walks.
